intro: Nycterium fontanesianum, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a strong fragrance to attract nocturnal pollinators. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often covered with fine hairs. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release the seeds when mature.
